Articles.Content:
I was trying to see how many ships I could fit on the water tower, and realized it would be fun to try landing on other ships:

![8ghZn.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/8ghZn.jpg)

Try not to knock your stack over, or keep the engine burning against another ship for too long!

Rules:

- [li]Stock parts only[/li]  
[li]Must land directly on command pod (no parts above pod)[/li]  
[li]Stack as many ships on each other to win[/li]  
[li]Post screenshot of your stack(preferably with the shadows visible)[/li]

Only the tallest single stack counts.
This is original, I think. I\'m going to enjoy coming back later to see peoples\' progress.
I like the idea, I just lost 5 ships trying to just land 1 on there, how do you do it, some small hint please?

I keep SAS on, use no RCS, thrust upwards slowly and tap the direction I want to go in. This gets corrected by the SAS quickly, but starts you drifting sideways a bit. Lots of really short key taps. I keep my speed under 10m/s at almost all times.

I had a failed launch sequence once, and managed to land the Mun Lander on top of a LFT by accident. The next time I tried, same thing happened, and managed to land it right on top of the original failed attempt lander, again quite by accident. Wish I had the screenshots (was certain I had at least one, but can\'t locate it at the moment).

Going to give this challenge a try soon! Sounds original and fun!

![JJ6ga.png](http://i.imgur.com/JJ6ga.png)

Unfortunately changing the time dilation to 2x made it promptly fall over, despite staying stable for several minutes beforehand. Used nothing but RCS this time, but had an engine on the back to make it easier to see where I was landing.

> 
> Wait...This is nearly impossible...

I can confirm that it\'s damn difficult, I just managed to land 1 (one!) ship on that tower ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Trying to get a second one on there now.

Tanks Panic for the hints!
